text: Calothyrza margaritifera is a species of beetle in the family Cerambycidae. It was described by John O. Westwood in 1848 in his "The Cabinet of Oriental Entomology" as Phryneta margaritifera. ==Range== Its range has been recorded in literature from Myanmar, India, Thailand, and Nepal.BioLib.cz - Calothyrza margaritifera. Retrieved on 8 September 2014. The type locality is Nepal. In India, it has been recorded in July 2009 from Pen, and subsequently a specimen collected in July 2018 from Chiplun, forming a new range extension to the Western Ghats and first properly documented collection of a specimen from India. ==Description== Illustration of Calothyrza maragaritifera from Westwood's 1848 work, The Cabinet of Oriental Entomology.
